comment: Sweet. Lots of corn. But not bad for a cheap bourbon.
Aroma - Citrus and classic bourbon spices. / taste - immediate char, vanilla and leather. / finish - spice fades in and orange peel finishes the profile
Slightly sweet with some corn, touch of pepper finish, oak in nose and taste.

Sweet and very complex. Brief spice that fades into vanilla and caramel and then comes back. Peanuts - can’t place the aroma, but it’s present. Not a high-rye guy but I do enjoy this and definitely can see this being in the bar frequently

Nose: sweet vegetal notes—not just corn but something like beets? Vanilla. Peanuts?
Palate: Peppery oak
Finish: Legitimately peanut butter, plus a delightful peppery tingle.
I think this will become a regular addition.  No frills, easy drink.
Cinnamon (much less than OGD 114). Some fruit. Spicey
Cinnamon and spice. Bit of a hug to follow but lots of flavor and spice.

Tasted in a plastic hotel room cup. 

Nose is spice, brown sugar, and bright lemon. 

Taste is spice and refreshing lemon. 

Has a thick syrupy mouth feel.
Hey, my name is whiskey. That’s it.

Nose: soft cherries, not a heavy nose. A bit of caramel, very much a classic bourbon nose though

Palate: very light like a scotch. A little sweet but thin. Caramel. Drinks well for 100 proof. 

Finish: medium/short very soft caramel
Loads of orange and vanilla. Like a dreamsicle, really liked it
You can tase the Basil Hayden influence in this. Stronger finish than I like but the orange aromas make for a great Old Fashioned!!
Spicy. Good bourbon for whiskey sours
Great for a bold and tasty Old Fashioned

Slight pepper.  Sweet up front. A kind Carmel butterscotch sweet. Green apple. With a little leather chair that has been in a smoking room like a pipe tobacco smell saturated broken in leather lounge chair.
